Topolomemory is a concentration game in which you have to match shapes using the principles of  Topology. In it's basic form, topology shows us that a doughnut is the same as a coffee mug.

Lay out the tiles with various images on them and whoever most quickly identifies pairs that match topologically gets to collect the pair. The player with the most pairs wins the game. The game game be played by more than five players, especially in teams.
User summary

Name: Battle of Qingshuping
Description: The first issue of Mini Wargame Magazine. Attached is a wargame that simulates the Battle of Qingshupingï¼ˆé’æ ‘åªæˆ˜å½¹ï¼‰ during the Second Chinese Civil War.

Name: Mr. Cabbagehead's Garden: Donty Monn promo card
Description:
Promo neighbor for the KS campaign "Mr. Cabbagehead's Garden returns!" (2020)
Donty Monn …is the self-proclaimed Village garden expert and always knows just what goes where. 
Donty's transplant ability will cause the card with the highest Vegetable number to be replaced with a card previously discarded.

Name: Mr. Cabbagehead's Garden: Leticia Colewort promo card
Description:
Promo neighbor for the KS campaign "Mr. Cabbagehead's Garden returns!" (2020)

Leticia Colewort ...loves to house sit for her neighbours, she also loves looking in their closets and drawers. 
Leticia will actually cause one of the Neighbours not used in the current game to visit Mr. Cabbagehead's Garden!

Name: The Adventurer's Tale
Description:
A solitaire push-your-luck roll & write game of dungeon design. Designed for the 5th Roll and Write Game Design Contest.

You must design a dungeon for an adventurer. Your aim is for the adventurer to survive to tell the tale, and for the tale to be worth the telling. Pack the dungeon with as many walls, treasures, potions, traps and monsters as you can get away with, but don't block the exit or kill the adventurer!

Roll 4 dice and use them to assign walls, a treasure,  a monster, or occasionally a trap or potion to a location on the map. You may use shields to modify the dice rolls. But if you push your luck too far, you may end up creating rock falls and blocking the adventurer from reaching the exit.

A gamesheet is provided, but the game may also be played on squared paper. Multiple players may play simultaneously by using shared dice rolls.

—description from the publisher

Name: Rune: Adepts Micro Expansion
Description:
Recruit an adept to help you with the summoning.
Borrow his power and claim your victory!

At the beginning of the game, choose which of the two Adepts you want to play with. Their abilities will allow you to have an extra card in your hands or place a card ignoring placement rules.

—description from the publisher

Name: NomadSed
Description:
NomadSed is a strategic board game where players assume the role of nomadic herders and try to increase their livestock capital. They have to make decisions that do not only depend on the state of the pastures, but also on daily challenges related to life in the steppe. At times, it makes sense to invest money and buy extra fodder; at others, sheep have to be sold at the market; and sometimes, cooperating with your neighbours is the best choice.

The players’ goal is to obtain as many animals and as much cash as possible. In the end, it will be seen whether this is best achieved by exploiting the lands or through considerate resource utilisation.

The players possess livestock herds, monetary resources, rangelands, and their own labour force which is expressed in action points. Not all pastures on the board are equally productive: fertile grasslands, as well as barren steppes, provide the dietary staples for the animals, and both are easily exhausted. Herd mobility is therefore vital.
Moreover, the players have various options for action so they can persist in the face of external adversities and prevail against the others. At the market, they may buy fodder, sell part of their livestock, or purchase additional animals. Development cards open up new options and alternative income sources.

The challenges faced by nomads are considerable. Year after year, they have to cope with different types of unexpected events. Recurrent external influences, whether local (drought, snowstorms, illness, legislation) or global in nature (price increases in animal fodder), determine their scopes of action. Only those who are flexible enough will prevail in the world of NomadSed.

NomadSed is entertaining and instructive all at once. Current problems that are faced by nomadic societies across the globe have been adapted into a game which offers insights into a unique subject matter. It has successfully been used in schools and universities to delve into the complex social-ecological conditions of land use in drylands. 
The board game can be borrowed for educational purposes in an easily transportable version whose design has been registered.
The game was jointly developed in the context of the DFG-funded Collaborative Research Centre 586 ‘Difference and Integration’ in cooperation between the Helmholtz Centre for Environmental Research – UFZ Leipzig, the University of Leipzig, and the Berlin University of the Arts.

Name: Supertall: Wrecktar Returns
Description:
Wrecktar is breaking free of Sprawlopolis and making its way UP the buildings of Supertall. This one card expansion puts some monster-sized pressure on your opponents.

Scoring: If this tower matches the City Hall plan type, score 5 points. Otherwise, score none for this tower.


Released in the November 2018 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

Name: Abstrakto
Description:
A two-player strategic game designed by Néstor Romeral Andrés and José Manuel Astilleros García-Monge.

Abstrakto is a game of territorial occupation in which players try to claim territory on the board by closing off empty areas with three different types of tiles (“Solid”, “Line”, and “Cross”) according to simple placement rules. A closed area is conquered by the player with most tiles surrounding it.

COMPONENTS

• A 7 × 7 square board
    • 18 blue tiles (6 of each type) 
    • 18 orange tiles (6 of each type)
    • 25 scoring markers (10 blue and 10 orange and 5 grey)

“Solid” tiles can only be placed inside the board cells.
      
“Line” tiles can only be placed centered on the edges of the board cells, including the edge of the board.
      
“Cross” tiles can only be placed on the lines’ intersections, excluding the edge and the corner of the board (in those places, the tile’s lines would extend beyond the underlying gridlines of the cell borders).

Name: Mousquetaires du Roy: Promo cards and board
Description:
Published in Ystari magazine issue 1 (February 2011, p. 18).

Three new cards: De Bar (minion card), La Poursuite (trap card), Larcin (treachery card).

New board:
Each Musketeer can challenge Milady once in the game to win a bonus. This challenge can be launched from anywhere and costs one action.

Name: Oathmark: Battlesworn
Description:
Oathmark: Battlesworn is a supplement for Oathmark: Battles of the Lost Age, giving players rules for creating elite units of warriors known as "battlesworn" and charting their progress from battle-to-battle.

In the horror and chaos of battle, the outcome can often hang on the briefest of moments. It is at these times that the actions of one unit can make the difference between victory and defeat. Wise kings know this and realize that it is often prudent to hold back their best units until they can make the greatest difference. These elite units, called the "battlesworn", are more than just powerful combatants, they are symbols of the glory and honor of a kingdom. All young warriors hope to one day join their ranks and add their oathmarks beside those legendary fighters.

This supplement for Oathmark: Battles of the Lost Age contains rules for adding elite units to your armies and charting their progress from battle to battle. Will they grow even more powerful as they gain renown, or be broken in the face of tremendous odds, perhaps someday to be reformed when their kingdom needs them most? Also included are rules for rivers and boats as well as campaigns, featuring all-new scenarios that will give your battlesworn the chance to lead their kingdom to new heights of power and prestige.

Name: Frostgrave: Second Edition – The Red King
Description:
Fires rage throughout the Frozen City as an inhuman army pours out of the cracks between realities. In the distant past, a cabal of city elders sought to save their lives by making a pact with a demon prince...and now the Red King has come to collect what he is owed, claiming Frostgrave as his own. Many have already fled before the Red King's demonic hordes, while others seek to weather the storm, turning their bases into makeshift fortresses. The wizards of Frostgrave must choose: Do they stand and fight, or do they abandon this great repository of mystical knowledge to the ravages of unearthly fire?

Frostgrave: The Red King is the first supplement designed for Frostgrave: Second Edition. In this sprawling, epic campaign, wizards will be pushed to their limits, fighting not only against one another and the perils of the Frozen City, but also against an invading army. As the Red King's power grows, the laws of magic and nature will start to bend. Can the wizards put aside their differences long enough to oppose this common foe, or will greed and mistrust doom them all?

Name: Ancient Warfare Army Lists suitable for Fast Play Rules & Big Battles
Description:
"The Army Lists in this booklet have primarily been compiled for use with the Fast Play Ancient Warfare Rules published by Newbury Rules. They may also be used in conjunction with other rules including our own 'Warfare in the Ancient World', though some amendment of the troop descriptions and figure points values will be required. The novel format of the Lists is designed to enable the player to devise his model army quickly and simply whilst ensuring a realistic balance of the component troop types, this is of course in keeping with the concept of the Fast Play Rules themselves." - Ancient Warfare Army Lists suitable for Fast Play Rules & Big Battles, R. G. Boss & T. J. Halsall, Newbury Rules, 1985, p.1

Additional section (pages 35-36) on converting these lists for other rules, in particular WRG War Games Rules 3000 BC to 1485 AD, 6th Edition.

Name: Oh My Gourd!
Description:
Grow a giant gourd with the help of your gardening tools and a Lucky Ladybug, but watch out! Clever critters, mean Mr. Frost, and big bad weeds will keep your gourd from growing. Protect your garden from unwanted guests and give it everything a growing gourd needs to win!

—description from the publisher

Name: Two Empires
Description:
Two rival civilizations clash as they expand their borders and vie for control of important territories. You must lead your people to victory, as only one empire is destined to rule the land.

Two Empires is a two-player area control and card placement game using a deck of 18 identical cards. In the game each player will take on the role of either the Red Overlord or the Blue Emperor. You will make key decisions on where to put cards on the map in order to lead your people's growth from tribal villages into a vast empire. Players will score points for Cities, Provinces, and Mines. The player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.
Families: Contests: Button Shy Game Design Contests and Challenges

Name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Magneto & Toad
Description:
Max Eisenhardt, the man who would become Magneto, faced unimaginable discrimination and evil during the Third Reich’s rise to power in World War II. He survived, thanks in part to the manifestation of his mutant power to control magnetic fields. Following the war, he resolved that such a fate would never befall mutant kind. An uncompromising freedom fighter for his fellow mutants, his extreme beliefs for mutant superiority drove a wedge between Magneto and his close friend, Professor Xavier. Magneto’s vision for mutant kind caused him to form the Brotherhood of Mutants, who fight for mutant supremacy.

Mortimer Toynbee, known as Toad, is a genetically flawed mutant. Visibly mutated since birth, he was abandoned by his parents to an orphanage where he was ostracized for his appearance. When Magneto discovered and recruited him, Toad embraced the mission to conquer the human race who had rejected and degraded him. Toad serves Magneto as an unquestioning lackey using his mutant abilities of enhanced jumping and prehensile tongue.

Name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Storm & Cyclops
Description:
Scott Summers is Cyclops, the first member of the mutant team theX-Men. Summers’ mutant power causes him to produce beams of optic force from his eyes. Unable to control these beams, Cyclops must wear protective ruby lenses to shield others from his mutant ability. As the field leader of theX-Men, Cyclops is a master tactician and skilled combatant who never stops fighting for equality between mutants and human kind.

Ororo Munroe descends from along line of witch-priestesses.Once worshipped as a goddess of the storm, she is a mutant with the ability to control the weather, able to produce hurricane winds and summon lightning at a whim. After a chance encounter with Professor Xavier, Munroe joined his task force, the X-Men. As a member of the X-Men, she is Storm, a capable leader and one of the most powerful mutants in existence.

Name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Wolverine & Sabretooth
Description:
Wolverine is a man whose past is shrouded in mystery. His mutant power of enhanced regeneration not only protects him from harm but has dramatically increased his life span. It also made him the ideal subject for the Weapon X project, which bonded indestructible metal to his skeleton and claws while robbing him of his memory. As a member of the X-Men, Wolverine is a gruff and vicious member of the team who often clashes with the team’s leader, Cyclops.

The mutant Victor Creed, called Sabertooth by many, is a feral assassin and mercenary. His mutant abilities grant him an enhanced healing rate, keen senses, and razor-sharp claws he uses to savage his foes. He is a long-time enemy ofWolverine. Their pasts intertwine through decades of conflict, and Sabertooth acts as a dark mirror of Wolverine’s suppressed savage instincts.

Name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Mystique & Beast
Description:
Mystique is a peerless shapeshifter, able to alter her physical appearance and voice to match another person’s as a perfect mimic. Little is known about her early life, though she has claimed to be over 100 years old. During her life, she has assassinated several significant figures involved in mutant affairs, imitated high-ranking generals and politicians, and clashed with the X-Men on numerous occasions.

Dr. Hank McCoy is a founding member of the X-Men who possesses enhanced agility and genius-level intellect. McCoy has undergone progressive mutations that have increasingly given him a feral, bestial appearance, including fangs, claws, and superhuman senses. Though his visage is animalistic, Beast retains his intelligence and is a global authority on matters of mutant kind, a top-tier geneticist, and a fierce advocate for mutant rights.

Name: 果実の収穫 (The Fruit Harvest)
Description:
There is a mysterious apple orchard.
And the time for harvesting has once again arrived.â€¨â€¨

Protect your orchard from insects and birds while taking care of your trees and harvesting your apples.â€¨Let’s gather as many apples as we can.

Each player tends to their own orchard and collects apples by strategically placing trees and apples.

On each turn, a player should lay down two cards (face up) from their hand to build their personal orchard. There are two types of cards: apples and trees. An orchard is made up a tree column and an apple column. Tree cards are played into the tree column to form a trunk. When the total value of the trunk is greater than or equal to 100, harvesting begins. If the trunk’s value is exactly 100, it is an abundant harvest and therefore the player may harvest all apples that they have placed into their apple column. If the value is greater than 100, the player may only harvest a single apple (the uppermost card aka the most recently placed card).

After harvesting, all tree cards are disposed and the player must work to grow another tree.

In addition, a player may also place down cards horizontally to achieve different effects.â€¨â€¨

An apple card of the same number can be placed horizontally to create a “cluster” of fruit. If, for example, this cluster is at the top of the apple column and a player begins harvesting after going over 100 in value, the player will be able to collect all the apples in the cluster (instead of just a single apple). However, if a player harvests their apples upon fulfilling the exactly 100 value requirement, they will only be able to harvest up till the first cluster and not the whole column.â€¨â€¨

A tree card of the same number as another tree card can also be placed horizontally to create a branch. After harvesting, the non-trunk cards of this branch do not need to be disposed and instead can be rearranged to form a new column as the new trunk.â€¨â€¨

In addition, branches give the player the option to include or exclude the cards forming the branch in their total tree value count (towards 100).

Branches and clusters can only be continuously built on the uppermost card (aka most recently placed card) for the column.

In this game, you can also chose to help tend your neighbor’s orchard. You may play any card into their orchard instead of your own. If by doing this you fulfill the 100 value requirement for harvest, you will receive half of your neighbor’s apple cards (you chose which half). If you fulfill the over 100 value requirement instead, you will battle with your neighbor over the single apple/cluster card(s).

â€¨â€¨Battling consists of playing a “war”-esque game where both players simultaneously reveal a card from their hand. The player with the higher value tree card will win the apple Card. (Except for in the case that the highest card is 50, which will then allow for a 5 card to win instead.)

â€¨â€¨At the end of the game (when the drawing deck is empty), this battling comes back into play to decide who gets the remaining unharvested apples in everyone’s orchards.

There are also some special cards including a pigeon card, a woodpecker card, and a bug card which have different effects. Like apple and tree cards, players can choose to play them into their opponents’ orchards.â€¨

Name: Catan: Starfarers – Space Jump
Description:
Do you dare to jump in space?

With the Catan: Starfarers – Space Jump promo encounter card, you expand your deck of cards in Catan: Starfarers and can now compare your friendship cards in order to jump through the galaxy with one of your spaceships.

Name: カルマノルマ (Karman Norm)
Description:
The explosive population growth of human beings in modern times was caused by "insufficient extinguishing of the light of life" by the young Grim Reapers who still have to learn.
Again today, young Grim Reapers go out in the city in search of the "lights of life".

The players become Grim Reapers and want to blow the lights out of as many people as possible.
The game is played over a Day and Night phase. In the day phase the players try to collect as many matches (people) as possible and in the night phase the matches need to be blown out in order to score points.

In turn order each player plays a card from their hand and whoever played the highest card can go first and put down the card at any of the available locations. Then, the players check who has the majority in card values on each location and get matches or blow out matches according to what is printed on the location card.

At the end of the game blown out matches are worth 1 point, burning matches are worth -1 point. The player with the most points wins the game.

Name: AXIO: Duel Hexagonal
Description:
New duel variant for 2 players, with an additional duel board and 6 duel tokens.

How to play:

Setup: Instead of using individual score boards, place the duel board between the two players. Use only one set of counters, placing one counter of each colour on the dividing line in the middle of each track on the duel board.

Gameplay: Play as usual. When you score, advance the respective colour counters on the duel board in your direction. You cannot advance the counters beyond the final space (value 9) on your side of the duel board. For each counter that reaches the final space, call out “Axio” and place the corresponding duel token face up in front of you. Then you get an instant bonus play of one tile as usual.

Scoring: The player with more counters on his side of the score board wins. To break a tie, when both players have 3 counters on their side, compare the lowest positions of the counters on each side, as usual.
